A bus is a road vehicle designed to carry many passengers. Buses can have a capacity as high as 300 passengers.

A Volkswagen Type 2, known officially (depending on body type) as the Transporter, Kombi or Microbus, or, informally, as the Bus (US) or Camper (UK), is a forward control panel van introduced in 1950 by the German automaker Volkswagen as its second car model.
